inscription: On one long edge on underside and on one short end of box in red: L82.29.17. On wood box, verso: 草文皿 {Kusamon zara}; on recto: 俊子作 {Toshiko saku} and red seal 俊子〇〇 {Toshiko ??}.
markings: 俊 {Toshi} stamp at center on underside
medium: Stoneware with polychrome over- and under-glazing
text:
Furukawa’s work is characterized by asymmetrical yet harmonious compositions, often featuring irregular bands

of alternating solid colors enlivened with subtle decorative motifs. Her fluid, delicate brushwork and sensitive

use of color create a lyrical counterpoint to the angular, functional forms of her ceramics, with her designs
flowing seamlessly across every surface of the vessel. This rectangular platter with slightly curved edges, is

decorated with red grasses over a white field.
title: Plate with Grass Pattern
